questions.question_text: During which phase of PPPoE is PPP authentication performed?

discussion.content:
PPP Configuration Options 
Since PPP includes the LCP protocol, the following LCP parameters can be controlled:

Authentication . RFC 1994 describes the Challenge Handshake Authentication Protocol ( CHAP ) which is the preferred way to perform PPP authentication, although the Password Authentication Protocol ( PAP ) is sometimes still used. Another option for authentication is the Extensible Authentication Protocol ( EAP ).
Compression . Effectively increases the throughput of a PPP connection by compressing data in a frame. The best known PPP frame compression algorithms are Stacker and Predictor.
Error detection . Includes Quality-Protocol and helps identify feedback loops through Magic Numbers RFC 1661 .
Multichannel . Multilink PPP (MLPPP, MPPP, MLP) provides methods for propagating traffic over multiple physical links with a single logical connection. This option allows you to expand bandwidth and provides load balancing.

Selected Answer: A
the PPP Session phase

questions.question_text: How can you disable DTP on a switch port?

choices.C: Change the operational mode to static access
choices.D: Change the administrative mode to access
choices.A: Configure the switch port as a trunk.
choices.B: Add an interface on the switch to a channel group.

discussion.content: No D is correct i think, Dynamic trunking protocol can't be used on a switchport in access mode

questions.question_text: Which Type of ipv6 unicast ip address is reachable across the Internet?

choices.C: A valid route to the destination address is missing from the routing table.
choices.B: The tunnel source interface is down.
choices.F: An ACL is blocking the outbound traffic.
choices.A: The tunnel interface IP address is misconfigured.
choices.D: The tunnel address is routed through the tunnel itself.
choices.E: The ISP is blocking the traffic.

questions.question_text: Which three circumstances can cause a GRE tunnel to be in an up/down state? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BCD
Under normal circumstances, there are only three reasons for a GRE tunnel to be in the up/down state: 

There is no route, which includes the default route, to the tunnel destination address.
The interface that anchors the tunnel source is down.
The route to the tunnel destination address is through the tunnel itself, which results in recursion.

Selected Answer: BCD
B. The tunnel source interface is down.
C. A valid route to the destination address is missing from the routing table.
D. The tunnel address is routed through the tunnel itself.

questions.question_text: Which logging command can enable administrators to correlate syslog messages with millisecond precision?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The answer is D

Selected Answer: D
he time-stamp format for datetime is MMM DD HH:MM:SS, where MMM is the month, DD is the date, HH is the hour (in 24-hour notation), MM is the minute, and SS is the second. With the additional keyword msec, the system includes milliseconds in the time stamp, in the format HH:DD:MM:SS.mmm, where .mmm is milliseconds.

The “service timestamps log” command configures the system to apply a time stamp to logging messages. The time-stamp format for datetime is MMM DD HH:MM:SS, where MMM is the month, DD is the date, HH is the hour (in 24-hour notation), MM is the minute, and SS is the second. With the additional keyword msec, the system includes milliseconds in the time stamp, in the format HH:DD:MM:SS.mmm, where .mmm is milliseconds.
